question: A company needs to encrypt a large quantity of data. The data encryption keys must be generated from a dedicated, tamper-resistant hardware device. To deliver these requirements, which AWS service should the company use?
options: AWS KMS
AWS IAM
AWS Certificate Manager
AWS CloudHSM
answer: AWS CloudHSM

question: An application uses Amazon Kinesis Data Streams to ingest and process large streams of data records in real time. Amazon EC2 instances consume and process the data using the Amazon Kinesis Client Library (KCL). The application handles the failure scenarios and does not require standby workers. The application reports that a specific shard is receiving more data than expected. To adapt to the changes in the rate of data flow, the �hot� shard is resharded.
question_2: Assuming that the initial number of shards in the Kinesis data stream is 6, and after resharding the number of shards increased to 8, what is the maximum number of EC2 instances that can be deployed to process data from all the shards?

question: A Developer needs to setup a new serverless application that includes AWS Lambda and Amazon API Gateway as part of a single stack. The Developer needs to be able to locally build and test the serverless applications before deployment on AWS.
question_2: Which service should the Developer use?
options: AWS Elastic Beanstalk
AWS CloudFormation
AWS Serverless Application Model (SAM)
AWS CodeBuild
answer: AWS Serverless Application Model (SAM)

question: An AWS Lambda function must be connected to an Amazon VPC private subnet that does not have Internet access. The function also connects to an Amazon DynamoDB table.
question_2: What MUST a Developer do to enable access to the DynamoDB table?
options: Attach an Internet Gateway
Configure a VPC endpoint
Attach an ENI to the DynamoDB table
Create a route table
answer: Configure a VPC endpoint

question: A company needs a fully-managed source control service that will work in AWS. The service must ensure that revision control synchronizes multiple distributed repositories by exchanging sets of changes peer-to-peer. All users need to work productively even when not connected to a network.
question_2: Which source control service should be used?
options: AWS CodeBuild
AWS CodeStar
AWS CodeCommit
Subversion
answer: AWS CodeCommit

question: You run an ad-supported photo sharing website using Amazon S3 to serve photos to visitors of your site. At some point you find out that other sites have been linking to the photos on your site, causing loss to your business.
question_2: What is an effective method to mitigate this?
options: Block the IPs of the offending websites in Security Groups
Use CloudFront distributions for static content
Store photos on an EBS volume of the web server
Remove public read access and use signed URLs with expiry dates
answer: Remove public read access and use signed URLs with expiry dates

question: A developer is creating a serverless application that will use a DynamoDB table. The average item size is 9KB. The application will make 4 strongly consistent reads/sec, and 2 standard write/sec.
question_2: How many RCUs/WCUs are required?
options: 12 RCU and 18 WCU
24 RCU and 18 WCU
6 RCU and 18 WCU
12 RCU and 36 WCU
answer: 12 RCU and 18 WCU

question: A Development team have moved their continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) pipeline into the AWS Cloud. The team is leveraging AWS CodeCommit for management of source code. The team need to compile their source code, run tests, and produce software packages that are ready for deployment.
question_2: Which AWS service can deliver these outcomes?
options: AWS Cloud9
AWS CodePipeline
AWS CodeBuild
AWS CodeCommit
answer: AWS CodeBuild

question: Every time an Amazon EC2 instance is launched, certain metadata about the instance should be recorded in an Amazon DynamoDB table. The data is gathered and written to the table by an AWS Lambda function.
question_2: What is the MOST efficient method of invoking the Lambda function?
options: Create a CloudTrail trail alarm that triggers the Lambda function based on the RunInstances API action
Create a CloudWatch Event with an event pattern looking for EC2 state changes and a target set to use the Lambda function
Create a CloudWatch alarm that triggers the Lambda function based on log streams indicating an EC2 state change in CloudWatch logs
Configure detailed monitoring on Amazon EC2 and create an alarm that triggers the Lambda function in initialization
answer: Create a CloudWatch Event with an event pattern looking for EC2 state changes and a target set to use the Lambda function

question: A developer is making some updates to an AWS Lambda function that is part of a serverless application and will be saving a new version. The application is used by hundreds of users and the developer needs to be able to test the updates and be able to rollback if there any issues with user experience.
question_2: What is the SAFEST way to do this with minimal changes to the application code?
options: Create A records in Route 53 for each function version�s ARN. Use a weighted routing policy to direct 20% of traffic to the new version. Add the DNS records to the application code
Create an alias and point it to the new version. Update the application code to point to the new alias
Create an alias and point it to the new and previous versions. Assign a weight of 20% to the new version to direct less traffic. Update the application code to point to the new alias
Update the application code to point to the new version
answer: Create an alias and point it to the new and previous versions. Assign a weight of 20% to the new version to direct less traffic. Update the application code to point to the new alias

question: An application runs on Amazon EC2 and generates log files. A Developer needs to centralize the log files so they can be queried and retained. What is the EASIEST way for the Developer to centralize the log files?
options: Create a script that uses the AWS SDK to collect and send the log files to Amazon CloudWatch Logs
Create a script that copies the log files to Amazon S3 and use a cron job to run the script on a recurring schedule
Install the Amazon CloudWatch Logs agent and collect the logs from the instances
Setup a CloudWatch Events rule to trigger an SNS topic when an application log file is generated
answer: Install the Amazon CloudWatch Logs agent and collect the logs from the instances

question: A Developer has created an AWS Lambda function in a new AWS account. The function is expected to be invoked 40 times per second and the execution duration will be around 100 seconds. What MUST the Developer do to ensure there are no errors?
options: Implement a Dead Letter Queue to capture invocation errors
Implement error handling within the function code
Contact AWS Support to increase the concurrent execution limits
Implement tracing with X-Ray
answer: Contact AWS Support to increase the concurrent execution limits

question: An IT automation architecture uses many AWS Lambda functions invoking one another as a large state machine. The coordination of this state machine is legacy custom code that breaks easily.
question_2: Which AWS Service can help refactor and manage the state machine?
options: AWS Step Functions
AWS CloudFormation
AWS CodePipeline
AWS CodeBuild
answer: AWS Step Functions

question: An application is running on a cluster of Amazon EC2 instances. The application has received an error when trying to read objects stored within an Amazon S3 bucket. The bucket is encrypted with server-side encryption and AWS KMS managed keys (SSE-KMS). The error is as follows:
question_2: Service: AWSKMS; Status Code: 400, Error Code: ThrottlingException, Which combination of steps should be taken to prevent this failure? (Select TWO.)
options: Import a customer master key (CMK) with a larger key size
Perform error retries with exponential backoff in the application code
Use more than once customer master key (CMK) to encrypt S3 data
Contact AWS support to request an S3 rate limit increase
Contact AWS support to request an AWS KMS rate limit increase
answer: Perform error retries with exponential backoff in the application code
Contact AWS support to request an AWS KMS rate limit increase

question: A Developer needs to restrict all users and roles from using a list of API actions within a member account in AWS Organizations. The Developer needs to deny access to a few specific API actions.
question_2: What is the MOST efficient way to do this?
options: Create an IAM policy that denies the API actions for all users and roles
Create an IAM policy that allows only the unrestricted API actions
Create an allow list and specify the API actions to deny
Create a deny list and specify the API actions to deny
answer: Create a deny list and specify the API actions to deny

question: A Developer needs to access AWS CodeCommit over SSH. The SSH keys configured to access AWS CodeCommit are tied to a user with the following permissions: The Developer needs to create/delete branches.
question_2: Which specific IAM permissions need to be added based on the principle of least privilege?
options: �codecommit:*�
�codecommit:Put*:�
�codecommit:Update*�
�codecommit:CreateBranch� and �codecommit:DeleteBranch�
answer: �codecommit:CreateBranch� and �codecommit:DeleteBranch�

question: A Developer has created a task definition that includes the following JSON code:
question_2: What will be the effect for tasks using this task definition?
options: They will become members of a task group called �databases�
They will not be allowed to run unless they have the �databases� tag assigned
They will not be placed on container instances in the �databases� task group
They will be placed on container instances in the �databases� task group
answer: They will be placed on container instances in the �databases� task group

question: A Developer needs to return a list of items in a global secondary index from an Amazon DynamoDB table.
question_2: Which DynamoDB API call can the Developer use in order to consume the LEAST number of read capacity units?
options: Query operation using strongly-consistent reads
Scan operation using strongly-consistent reads
Query operation using eventually-consistent reads
Scan operation using eventually-consistent reads
answer: Query operation using eventually-consistent reads

question: A Developer has setup an Amazon Kinesis Data Stream with 6 shards to ingest a maximum of 2000 records per second. An AWS Lambda function has been configured to process these records. In which order will these records be processed?
options: Lambda will receive each record in the exact order it was placed into the stream
Lambda will receive each record in the exact order it was placed into the shard. There is no guarantee of order across shards
The Developer can select exact order or reverse order using the GetRecords API
Lambda will receive each record in the reverse order it was placed into the stream
answer: Lambda will receive each record in the exact order it was placed into the shard. There is no guarantee of order across shards

question: An application uses Amazon EC2, and Application Load Balancer and Amazon CloudFront to serve content. The security team have reported malicious activity from a specific range of IP addresses.
question_2: How can a Developer prevent the application from being targeted by these addresses again?
options: Create a security group rule denying the address range and apply it to the EC2 instances
Disable the Amazon CloudFront distribution and then reenable it
Add a certificate using AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) and encrypt all communications
Add a rule to a Web ACL using AWS WAF that denies the IP address ranges
answer: Add a rule to a Web ACL using AWS WAF that denies the IP address ranges

question: A Developer has noticed some suspicious activity in her AWS account and is concerned that the access keys associated with her IAM user account may have been compromised. What is the first thing the Developer do in should do in this situation?
options: Delete her IAM user account
Delete the compromised access keys
Report the incident to AWS Support
Change her IAM User account password
answer: Delete the compromised access keys

question: An application running on Amazon EC2 is experiencing intermittent technical difficulties. The developer needs to find a solution for tracking the errors that occur in the application logs and setting up a notification when the error rate exceeds a certain threshold.
question_2: How can this be achieved with the LEAST complexity?
options: Configure Amazon CloudWatch Events to monitor the EC2 instances and configure an SNS topic as a target
Configure the application to send logs to Amazon S3. Use Amazon Kinesis Analytics to analyze the log files and send an SES notification
Use CloudTrail to monitor the application log files and send an SNS notification
Use CloudWatch Logs to track the number of errors that occur in the application logs and send an SNS notification
answer: Use CloudWatch Logs to track the number of errors that occur in the application logs and send an SNS notification

question: A company provides a large number of services on AWS to customers. The customers connect to one or more services directly and the architecture is becoming complex. How can the architecture be refactored to provide a single interface for the services?
options: AWS Single Sign On (SSO)
Amazon API Gateway
AWS Cognito
AWS X-Ray
answer: Amazon API Gateway

question: A company is running a Docker application on Amazon ECS. The application must scale based on user load in the last 15 seconds.
question_2: How should the Developer instrument the code so that the requirement can be met?
options: Create a standard-resolution custom Amazon CloudWatch metric for user activity data, then publish data every 30 seconds
Create a high-resolution custom Amazon CloudWatch metric for user activity data, then publish data every 5 seconds
Create a standard-resolution custom Amazon CloudWatch metric for user activity data, then publish data every 5 seconds
Create a high-resolution custom Amazon CloudWatch metric for user activity data, then publish data every 30 seconds
answer: Create a high-resolution custom Amazon CloudWatch metric for user activity data, then publish data every 5 seconds

question: A team of developers need to be able to collaborate and synchronize multiple distributed code repositories and leverage a pre-configured continuous delivery toolchain for deploying their projects on AWS. The team also require a centralized project dashboard to monitor application activity.
question_2: Which AWS service should they use?
options: AWS CodeCommit
AWS CodePipeline
AWS Cloud9
AWS CodeStar
answer: AWS CodeStar

question: An application scans an Amazon DynamoDB table once per day to produce a report. The scan is performed in non-peak hours when production usage uses around 50% of the provisioned throughput.
question_2: How can you MINIMIZE the time it takes to produce the report without affecting production workloads? (Select TWO.)
options: Use a Sequential Scan API operation
Use pagination to divide results into 1 MB pages
Use the Limit parameter
Use a Parallel Scan API operation
Increase read capacity units during the scan operation
answer: Use the Limit parameter
Use a Parallel Scan API operation

question: An application needs to read up to 100 items at a time from an Amazon DynamoDB. Each item is up to 100 KB in size and all attributes must be retrieved.
question_2: What is the BEST way to minimize latency?
options: Use a Scan operation with pagination
Use GetItem and use a projection expression
Use a Query operation with a FilterExpression
Use BatchGetItem
answer: Use BatchGetItem

question: An application is being instrumented to send trace data using AWS X-Ray. A Developer needs to upload segment documents using JSON-formatted strings to X-Ray using the API. Which API action should the developer use?
options: The PutTelemetryRecords API action
The PutTraceSegments API action
The UpdateGroup API action
The GetTraceSummaries API action
answer: The PutTraceSegments API action

question: Based on the following AWS CLI command the resulting output, what has happened here?
options: An AWS Lambda function has been invoked synchronously and has completed successfully
An AWS Lambda function has been invoked asynchronously and has completed successfully
An AWS Lambda function has been invoked asynchronously and has not completed successfully
An AWS Lambda function has been invoked synchronously and has not completed successfully
answer: An AWS Lambda function has been invoked synchronously and has completed successfully

question: A company manages an application that stores data in an Amazon DynamoDB table. The company need to keep a record of all new changes made to the DynamoDB table in another table within the same AWS region. What is the MOST suitable way to deliver this requirement?
options: Use Amazon DynamoDB streams
Use CloudWatch events
Use Amazon CloudTrail
Use Amazon DynamoDB snapshots
answer: Use Amazon DynamoDB streams

question: A Developer created an AWS Lambda function for a serverless application. The Lambda function has been executing for several minutes and the Developer cannot find any log data in CloudWatch Logs.
question_2: What is the MOST likely explanation for this issue?
options: The Lambda function does not have any explicit log statements for the log data to send it to CloudWatch Logs
The Lambda function is missing CloudWatch Logs as a source trigger to send log data
The Lambda function is missing a target CloudWatch Logs group
The execution role for the Lambda function is missing permissions to write log data to the CloudWatch Logs
answer: The execution role for the Lambda function is missing permissions to write log data to the CloudWatch Logs

question: A three-tier application is being migrated from an on-premises data center. The application includes an Apache Tomcat web tier, an application tier running on Linux, and a MySQL back end. A Developer must refactor the application to run on the AWS cloud. The cloud-based application must be fault tolerant and elastic.
question_2: How can the Developer refactor the web tier and application tier? (Select TWO.)
options: Create an Amazon CloudFront distribution for the web tier
Use a multi-AZ Amazon RDS database for the back end using the MySQL engine
Create an Auto Scaling group of EC2 instances for both the web tier and application tier
Implement an Elastic Load Balancer for the application tier
Implement an Elastic Load Balancer for both the web tier and the application tier
answer: Create an Auto Scaling group of EC2 instances for both the web tier and application tier
Implement an Elastic Load Balancer for both the web tier and the application tier

question: A Developer must run a shell script on Amazon EC2 Linux instances each time they are launched by an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group. What is the SIMPLEST way to run the script?
options: Package the script in a zip file with some AWS Lambda source code. Upload to Lambda and run the function when instances are launched
Add the script to the user data when creating the launch configuration
Run the script using the AWS Systems Manager Run Command
Configure Amazon CloudWatch Events to trigger the AWS CLI when an instance is launched and run the script
answer: Add the script to the user data when creating the launch configuration

question: Data must be loaded into an application each week for analysis. The data is uploaded to an Amazon S3 bucket from several offices around the world. Latency is slowing the uploads and delaying the analytics job. What is the SIMPLEST way to improve upload times?
options: Upload to a local Amazon S3 bucket within each region and enable Cross-Region Replication (CRR)
Upload via a managed AWS VPN connection
Upload using Amazon S3 Transfer Acceleration
Upload to Amazon CloudFront and then download from the local cache to the S3 bucket
answer: Upload using Amazon S3 Transfer Acceleration

question: A Developer needs to run some code using Lambda in response to an event and forward the execution result to another application using a pub/sub notification.
question_2: How can the Developer accomplish this?
options: Configure a Lambda �on success� destination and route the execution results to Amazon SNS
Configure a CloudWatch Events alarm the triggers based on Lambda execution success and route the execution results to Amazon SQS
Configure a CloudWatch Events alarm the triggers based on Lambda execution success and route the execution results to Amazon SNS
Configure a Lambda �on success� destination and route the execution results to Amazon SQS
answer: Configure a Lambda �on success� destination and route the execution results to Amazon SNS

question: A Developer is deploying an Amazon ECS update using AWS CodeDeploy. In the appspec.yaml file, which of the following is a valid structure for the order of hooks that should be specified?
options: BeforeInstall > AfterInstall > AfterAllowTestTraffic > BeforeAllowTraffic > AfterAllowTraffic
BeforeInstall > AfterInstall > ApplicationStart > ValidateService
BeforeAllowTraffic > AfterAllowTraffic
BeforeBlockTraffic > AfterBlockTraffic > BeforeAllowTraffic > AfterAllowTraffic
answer: BeforeInstall > AfterInstall > AfterAllowTestTraffic > BeforeAllowTraffic > AfterAllowTraffic

question: A gaming application displays the results of games in a leaderboard. The leaderboard is updated by 4 KB messages that are retrieved from an Amazon SQS queue. The updates are received infrequently but the Developer needs to minimize the time between the messages arriving in the queue and the leaderboard being updated.
question_2: Which technique provides the shortest delay in updating the leaderboard?
options: Store the message payload in Amazon S3 and use the SQS Extended Client Library for Java
Retrieve the messages from the queue using long polling every 15 seconds
Reduce the size of the messages with compression before sending them
Retrieve the messages from the queue using short polling every 10 seconds
answer: Retrieve the messages from the queue using long polling every 15 seconds

question: A developer has created a YAML template file that includes the following header: 'AWS: :Serverless-2016-10-31'. Which commands should the developer use to deploy the application?
options: aws cloudformation package and aws cloudformation create-stack
sam package and sam build
sam package and sam deploy
aws cloudformation create-stack-set
answer: sam package and sam deploy

question: A Developer has joined a team and needs to connect to the AWS CodeCommit repository using SSH. What should the Developer do to configure access using Git?
options: Generate an SSH public and private key. Upload the public key to the Developer�s IAM account
On the Developer�s IAM account, under security credentials, choose to create an access key and secret ID
Create an account on Github and user those login credentials to login to AWS CodeCommit
On the Developer�s IAM account, under security credentials, choose to create HTTPS Git credentials for AWS CodeCommit
answer: Generate an SSH public and private key. Upload the public key to the Developer�s IAM account

question: A Developer is writing an AWS Lambda function that processes records from an Amazon Kinesis Data Stream. The Developer must write the function so that it sends a notice to Administrators if it fails to process a batch of records.
question_2: How should the Developer write the function?
options: Configure an Amazon SNS topic as an on-failure destination
Use Amazon CloudWatch Events to send the processed data
Push the failed records to an Amazon SQS queue
Separate the Lambda handler from the core logic
answer: Configure an Amazon SNS topic as an on-failure destination

question: What does an Amazon SQS delay queue accomplish?
options: Messages are hidden for a configurable amount of time when they are first added to the queue
Message cannot be deleted for a configurable amount of time after they are consumed from the queue
The consumer can poll the queue for a configurable amount of time before retrieving a message
Messages are hidden for a configurable amount of time after they are consumed from the queue
answer: Messages are hidden for a configurable amount of time when they are first added to the queue

question: A company has several AWS accounts used by different departments. Developers use the same CloudFormation template to deploy an application across accounts. What can the developers use to deploy and manage the application with the LEAST operational effort?
options: Synchronize the applications in multiple accounts using AWS AppSync
Create a CloudFormation Stack in an administrator account and use CloudFormation Change Sets to modify stacks across multiple accounts
Create a CloudFormation Stack in an administrator account and use StackSets to update the stacks across multiple accounts
Migrate the application into an Elastic Beanstalk environment that is shared between multiple accounts
answer: Create a CloudFormation Stack in an administrator account and use StackSets to update the stacks across multiple accounts

question: A company uses an Amazon EC2 web application with Amazon CloudFront to distribute content to its customers globally. The company requires that all traffic is encrypted between the customers and CloudFront, and CloudFront and the web application.
question_2: What steps need to be taken to enforce this encryption? (Select TWO.)
options: Set the Viewer Protocol Policy to �HTTPS Only� or �Redirect HTTP to HTTPS�
Use AWS KMS to enforce encryption
Change the HTTP port to 443 in the Origin Settings
Set the Origin Protocol Policy to �HTTPS Only�
Enable Field Level Encryption
answer: Set the Viewer Protocol Policy to �HTTPS Only� or �Redirect HTTP to HTTPS�
Set the Origin Protocol Policy to �HTTPS Only�

question: A Developer is creating an AWS Lambda function that generates a new file each time it runs. Each new file must be checked into an AWS CodeCommit repository hosted in the same AWS account.
question_2: How should the Developer accomplish this?
options: After the new file is created in Lambda, use cURL to invoke the CodeCommit API. Send the file to the repository
Use an AWS SDK to instantiate a CodeCommit client. Invoke the put_file method to add the file to the repository
When the Lambda function starts, use the Git CLI to clone the repository. Check the new file into the cloned repository and push the change
Upload the new file to an Amazon S3 bucket. Create an AWS Step Function to accept S3 events. In the Step Function, add the new file to the repository
answer: Use an AWS SDK to instantiate a CodeCommit client. Invoke the put_file method to add the file to the repository

question: An Amazon Kinesis Data Stream has recently been configured to receive data from sensors in a manufacturing facility. A consumer EC2 instance is configured to process the data every 48 hours and save processing results to an Amazon RedShift data warehouse. Testing has identified a large amount of data is missing. A review of monitoring logs has identified that the sensors are sending data correctly and the EC2 instance is healthy.
question_2: What is the MOST likely explanation for this issue?
options: The EC2 instance is failing intermittently
Amazon Kinesis has too many shards provisioned
Records are retained for 24 hours in the Kinesis Data Stream by default
Amazon RedShift is not suitable for storing streaming data
answer: Records are retained for 24 hours in the Kinesis Data Stream by default
